mdRecord.dcterms:title: The People to the President: German melody: O Tannebaum, O Tannebaum, wie grün sind deine Blätter. : Air--Maryland, My Maryland / By a Lady of Washington City
Oh, let the Constitution stand, Abraham, our Abraham
To the President
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Lady of Washington City.
Magnus, Charles.
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Published by Chas. Magnus, 12 Frankfort St N.Y.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Civil war song sheet in 5 verses; without music; printed in blue in 2 columns on illustrated letter paper, with verso of sheet ruled in blue.
First line of text: Oh, let the Constitution stand, Abraham, our Abraham.
With advertisement "500 Illustrated Ballads lithographed and printed by Charles Magnus, No. 12 Frankfort Street, New York[.] Branch office, No. 520 7th St., Washington, D.C."
Charles Magnus published as an individual at 12 Frankfort St., New York, between 1860 and 1867. Works which also include his Washington, D.C. imprint were published about 1863 and 1864.
Hand-colored headpiece with caption "U.S. Troops descending the Mississippi, escorted by Gunboat." Magnus 121. Cf. American song sheets, 1867b.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Sixth of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Lincoln, Abraham, 1809-1865--Songs and music--Texts.
